title: Understanding Atomic Emission
text: Atomic emission spectroscopy relies on the principle that atoms emit light when they transition from a higher energy state to a lower energy state. This emitted light is characteristic of the element.

title: Energy States and Emission
text: When atoms absorb energy, they move to an excited state. As they return to their ground state, they release energy in the form of light. This light can be analyzed to determine the composition of the sample.

hintAnswer: Excited atoms returning to lower energy states
title: Identifying the Cause of Emission
text: What happens to atoms in a sample that causes them to emit light in atomic emission spectroscopy?
choices: Excited atoms returning to lower energy states
Atoms absorbing energy from a light source
Atoms being ionized by an electric field

title: Analyzing Emission Spectra
text: Each element emits light at specific wavelengths when it returns to a lower energy state. By analyzing these wavelengths, we can identify the elements present in the sample.

title: Practical Applications
text: Atomic emission spectroscopy is widely used in fields such as environmental analysis, metallurgy, and pharmaceuticals to determine the elemental composition of samples.
